concept.title: Wave Analytics
concept.shortdesc: The Wave Analytics destination writes data to Salesforce Wave Analytics. The destination connects to Wave Analytics to create a dataset with external data.

conbody.p: Wave Analytics destinationoverviewdestinationsWave AnalyticsSalesforce Wave Analytics destinationoverviewdestinationsSalesforce Wave AnalyticsWhen you configure the Wave Analytics destination, you define connection information, including the API version that the destination uses to connect to Salesforce Wave Analytics.

You specify the edgemart alias or name of the dataset to create. The destination typically creates multiple datasets for the edgemart alias, based on the dataset wait time that you configure for the destination. After no data has arrived for the specified wait time, the destination closes and uploads the dataset to Wave Analytics. When new data arrives, the destination creates a new dataset. Each dataset is named with the edgemart alias name and appended with the timestamp of when the dataset is uploaded.
You can optionally configure the destination to use a Wave Analytics dataflow to combine multiple datasets together. You can also specify the metadata of the external data in a JSON format.
You can optionally use an HTTP proxy to connect to Salesforce Wave Analytics.
